blog_graphql.tekstBlogaEng:
Ante Ružić – Baćo (1882- 1936), was an athlete from Split, a marathon runner, an eccentric and a comedy rag publisher. Another interesting Split eccentric who was acknowledged in the TV show “Velo misto” by Miljenko Smoje. There you can see Baćo running the streets of Split, thus thrilling people, but also being ridiculed by those who just could not realize why would anyone run that much without any clear goal.

It was these long runs through the streets of Split that made Baćo stand out. He would also run from Split to Solin, Klis, Sinj, Trogir, Dugi rat and Omiš, or from Drniš or Knin. He started these runs in 1905, as a 23-year-old, and he always ran on the Sudamja celebrations. He continued to do so regularly till 1930s.

In Split you could hear that Baćo used to run across America, England, Czech Republic, Hungary, Italy and France. But it was a known fact that Baćo’s first real races were races with the locals through Split. He became famous after his renowned race with the narrow-gauge railroad train called Rera. On September 27th 1908 he ran from Split to Klis in 15 minutes less than Rera. He even received a confirmation of that from the railway station Klis and the Klis commander getting him also 200 krune prize or elms. After that there was a famous local race with a horse, Sokol, in which of course Baćo won. The legend says that after this exhausting fight the horse started producing foam from the mouth and was hardly alive.

In 1916 Baćo was the object of delight again, running on the Riva, Split waterfront, backwards with a wheelbarrow. The local newspaper commentator had this to say on this unusual spectacle: “It is not that strange to see Baćo run, as it is to see the people who wasted whole three hours watching this spectacle.”

The best proof of him being loved and popular in Split is the fact that there were several postcards with his picture on them, and even one with the portrait of his son, who also ran with his father. One of the most interesting postcards is definitely the one showing Baćo after another race with a horse – in South America. There is no reliable proof that the photo was indeed taken there, as well as there’s no proof that Baćo ever lay foot on the South America’s soil. Moreover, one could hear people in Split saying that the scenography for this event was prepared and directed in detail in nearby Vranjic. With his refined sense of humor, which he demonstrated also through editing the Split comedy rags, Baćo had probably made fun with his dear fellow citizens and added some value to himself, to them but also to his beloved city. Isn’t it nice to hear that Split had a world champion in running, so powerful that he even left horses behind him? The real truth on his world runner’s undertakings will probably never be revealed.

Igor Goleš
blog_graphql.tekstBlogaHr:
Ante Ružić – Baćo ( 1882- 1936.),  bio je splitski atlet, trkač-maratonac, osobenjak i izdavač humorističkih listova . Još jedna osoba koja je svoje priznanje dobila u Tv seriji ˝Velo misto˝, Miljenka Smoje. Tamo možemo u nekoliko scena vidjeti Baću kako trči splitskim ulicama, izazivajući ushite oduševljenih građana, ali i podsmijeh nekih koji nikako nisu mogli shvatiti zašto netko toliko može trčati bez ikakvog cilja?

Baćo se počeo isticati upravo dugačkim trčanjima po splitskim ulicama koji su trajali satima, ili je trčao od Splita do Solina, Klisa, Sinja, Trogira, Dugog Rata i Omiša, te od Drniša i Knina.

Sa trčanjima je počeo 1905. godine kao dvadesetrogodišnjak, a redovito je trčao na proslavama Sudamije, a to je radio redovito do tridesetih godina 20.-tog stoljeća.

Po Splitu se pričalo kako je Bačo trčao u Americi, Engleskoj, Austriji, Češkoj, Mađarskoj, Italiji, i Francuskoj. Ali zna se da su prve prave trke Baće  s lokalnim konkurentima bile oko fontane popularno nazivane u Splitu ˝ Bajamontuša˝ pa i na Rivi. Slijedila je čuvena trka s feratom do Sinja 27. rujna 1908. godine kada je dionicu od Splita do Klisa pretrčao 15 minuta brže od ˝Rere˝ o čemu je dobio potvrdu željezničke stanice Klis i načelnika Klisa, a za to je dobio i 200 kruna milodara ili nagrade. Nakon nje usljedila je čuvena domaća  utrka sa konjem Sokolom u kojoj je naravno Baćo pobjedio, a  konj Sokol je bacio pjenu na usta  i jedva ostao živ.

1916. Baćo trči po Rivi i unatrag sa karijolom. Lokalni novinski komentator je ovako prokomentirao taj neuobičajeni spektakl: ˝Nije toliko čudno gledati Baću kako trči, koliko onaj okupljeni svijet koji je prodangubio puna tri sata˝.

Koliko je bio voljen i popularan u Splitu najbolje govori podatak o tome da je tiskano  nekoliko razglednica s njegovim likom, a jedna čak i s likom njegovog sina, koji je također trčao skupa s ocem.  Svakako jedna od najzanimljivih razglednica  je ona koja prikazuje Baču nakon još jedne utrke s konjem i to ni manje-više nego u Južnoj Americi. Ne postoje nikakvi pouzdani dokazi o tome da je fotografija zaista tamo i snimljena, kao ni dokazi da je Bačina noga ikada kročila na tlo Južne Amerike. Dapače, čak se po Splitu govorkalo i da je scenografija za ovaj događaj pripremljena u obližnjem Vranjicu. Bačo, istančanog smisla za humor , koji je između ostalog iskazivao i uređujući splitske humoristične listove, vjerovatno se našalio malo s milim mu sugrađanima i dao na značaju sebi, njima, ali i voljenom gradu. Zar nije lijepo da Split ima svjetskog prvaka u trčanju, toliko moćnog da i konje ostavlja iza sebe?  Pravu istinu vjerovatno nikada nećemo saznati…

Igor Goleš
